  "description": "Stella Maris School is full of happy and highly motivated children. We are committed to providing a warm, welcoming and nurturing atmosphere with a strong educational ethos and moral values.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Social Media Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja (FCT)&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Social Media Manager will be responsible for developing, implementing, and managing the school&#39;s social media strategy.
	This role aims to enhance brand visibility, engage the school community, and promote key events and initiatives across various social media platforms.


Responsibilities
Strategy Development:


	Create and execute a comprehensive social media strategy aligned with the school&#39;s marketing goals.
	Identify target audiences and develop content tailored to engage and resonate with diverse stakeholders.


Content Creation:


	Generate creative and compelling content for various social media platforms, including Facebook, Instagram, TikTok, Threads, Twitter, and LinkedIn.
	Collaborate with different departments to gather information and showcase the school&#39;s achievements, events, and educational initiatives.


Community Engagement:


	Foster positive interactions with the school community, parents, students, and alumni through active engagement on social media.
	Respond promptly to comments, messages, and inquiries while maintaining a consistent and positive brand voice.


Monitoring and Analytics:


	Monitor social media trends, tools, and applications to stay ahead of industry changes and emerging platforms.
	Use analytics tools to measure the effectiveness of social media campaigns and report on key performance indicators.


Brand Management:


	Ensure consistent branding and messaging across all social media channels.
	Implement and enforce social media guidelines to maintain the school&#39;s reputation and uphold brand standards.


Event Promotion:


	Collaborate with event organizers to create and implement social media campaigns to promote school events.
	Live-tweet, post updates, and share highlights during major school functions.


Collaboration:


	Work closely with the marketing and admissions team to integrate social media into broader marketing campaigns.
	Collaborate with teachers, staff, and students to feature their accomplishments and contributions on social media.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess an HND / Bachelor&rsquo;s / Master&#39;s Degree with relevant experience.&nbsp;


Method of Application

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Customer Support Lead",
  "description": "Human-Aware Real-Time Solutions Limited is an innovative service company revolutionizing the way businesses engage with their customers through online marketing and messaging. Our platform helps businesses deliver personalized, timely, and effective SMS communication, creating seamless connections between brands and their customers.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Customer Support Lead

Job Location:&nbsp;Yaba, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	As we scale, we&rsquo;re looking for a dynamic Customer Support Lead to help guide and inspire our support team in delivering exceptional service to our growing customer base.
	We are seeking a Customer Support Lead who will be responsible for overseeing the day-to-day operations of our customer support team, ensuring that all customer inquiries and issues are addressed efficiently and effectively.
	As a leader, you will play a key role in setting the tone for our support team&rsquo;s culture and ensuring the highest level of customer satisfaction.
	You will have a unique opportunity to shape the customer experience of a fast-growing tech startup and will work closely with Product, Engineering, and Marketing teams to ensure our customers are getting the best possible service.


Key Responsibilities
Team Leadership:


	Lead, motivate, and manage a team of customer support agents to deliver outstanding service.
	Conduct regular one-on-one meetings, team check-ins, and performance reviews.
	Help identify training needs and organize continuous learning for team members to improve their skills.


Customer Support Management:


	Oversee and manage day-to-day customer support operations, including tracking and responding to inbound inquiries via chat, email, phone, and social media.
	Monitor key customer support metrics (response times, customer satisfaction, etc.) and take necessary actions to improve team performance.
	Implement best practices for handling difficult or complex customer interactions and ensure quick resolution of issues.


Escalation Handling:


	Act as the point of escalation for any customer issues that require advanced troubleshooting or management intervention.
	Work with the engineering team to diagnose and resolve technical issues.


Process Improvement:


	Continuously analyze support workflows and customer feedback to identify areas for improvement.
	Develop and refine customer support procedures, tools, and documentation.
	Advocate for the voice of the customer and ensure customer feedback is communicated across the organization.


Collaboration &amp; Cross-Functional Support:


	Collaborate with Product, Sales, and Marketing teams to ensure a consistent customer experience across all touchpoints.
	Assist in product releases or feature updates by ensuring that customers are informed and properly supported.


Reporting &amp; Analytics:


	Generate regular reports on team performance, customer feedback, and emerging trends.
	Use data and customer insights to propose service enhancements and support strategies.


Requirements
Experience:


	2+ years in customer support, with at least 1 year in a leadership role (ideally in SaaS or tech support).
	Experience managing a team in a fast-paced, customer-first environment.
	Previous experience with online services or communication platforms is a plus.


Skills:


	Strong leadership, coaching, and team-building skills.
	Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
	Analytical mindset with the ability to use data to drive decisions.
	Ability to troubleshoot and resolve technical issues quickly.
	Knowledge of customer support tools (e.g., Zendesk, Freshdesk, Intercom) and ticketing systems is an added advantage.
	Familiarity with online marketing/engagement tools is a plus.


Personal Traits:


	A customer-focused attitude with a passion for providing exceptional support experiences.
	A self-starter with excellent time management skills.
	Empathetic, patient, and solutions-oriented approach when dealing with customers.
	Comfortable working in a startup environment that requires flexibility and adaptability.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Customer Support Lead

Job Location: Yaba, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description

	You will have a unique opportunity to shape the customer experience of a fast-growing tech startup and will work closely with Product, Engineering, and Marketing teams to ensure our customers are getting the best possible service.


Key Responsibilities
Team Leadership:


	Lead, motivate, and manage a team of customer support agents to deliver outstanding service.
	Conduct regular one-on-one meetings, team check-ins, and performance reviews.
	Help identify training needs and organize continuous learning for team members to improve their skills.


Customer Support Management:


	Oversee and manage day-to-day customer support operations, including tracking and responding to inbound inquiries via chat, email, phone, and social media.
	Monitor key customer support metrics (response times, customer satisfaction, etc.) and take necessary actions to improve team performance.
	Implement best practices for handling difficult or complex customer interactions and ensure quick resolution of issues.


Escalation Handling:


	Act as the point of escalation for any customer issues that require advanced troubleshooting or management intervention.
	Work with the engineering team to diagnose and resolve technical issues.

	Develop and refine customer support procedures, tools, and documentation.
	Advocate for the voice of the customer and ensure customer feedback is communicated across the organization.

	Collaborate with Product, Sales, and Marketing teams to ensure a consistent customer experience across all touchpoints.
	Assist in product releases or feature updates by ensuring that customers are informed and properly supported.


Reporting & Analytics:


	Generate regular reports on team performance, customer feedback, and emerging trends.

Requirements

	2+ years in customer support, with at least 1 year in a leadership role (ideally in SaaS or tech support).
	Experience managing a team in a fast-paced, customer-first environment.
	Previous experience with online services or communication platforms is a plus.


Skills:


	Strong leadership, coaching, and team-building skills.
	Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
	Analytical mindset with the ability to use data to drive decisions.
	Ability to troubleshoot and resolve technical issues quickly.
	Knowledge of customer support tools (e.g., Zendesk, Freshdesk, Intercom) and ticketing systems is an added advantage.
	Familiarity with online marketing/engagement tools is a plus.


Personal Traits:


	A customer-focused attitude with a passion for providing exceptional support experiences.
	A self-starter with excellent time management skills.
	Empathetic, patient, and solutions-oriented approach when dealing with customers.
	Comfortable working in a startup environment that requires flexibility and adaptability.

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Lead Procurement Officer",
  "description": "The Wells Carlton Hotel &amp; Apartments is a beautiful, fantasy-like journey into a glamorous world of pure luxury, privacy, exceptional service and gratifying indulgence. It is located in one of the most secured and serene locations in Abuja. The facility features an endless wave of sophistication, style &amp; glamour that leaves guests breathless whilst providing a unique sense of comfort and convenience.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Lead Procurement Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Asokoro, Abuja (FCT)&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time

Job&nbsp;Description


	A Lead Procurement Officer isa senior leader responsible for an organization&#39;s entire procurement strategy and operations, from sourcing and cost management to risk mitigation and supplier relationships.
	Key duties include developing and implementing purchasing strategies, negotiating contracts, leading the procurement team, ensuring compliance, and collaborating with other departments to align procurement with business goals.


Responsibilities
A Lead Procurement wears many hats, combining strategy, leadership, and hands-on decision-making. Here&#39;s what they typically do:


	Develop Procurement Strategies: design long-term plans to ensure the company gets the best value from suppliers while supporting business goals like cost savings, sustainability, or innovation.
	Manage Supplier Relationships: negotiate contracts, handle disputes, and build strong partnerships with key suppliers to ensure quality and reliability.
	Lead the Procurement Team: supervise purchasing managers, buyers, and other procurement staff, ensuring the team runs smoothly and meets performance targets.
	Control Budgets and Costs: monitor spending, find savings opportunities, and help departments stay within budget without sacrificing quality.
	Ensure Compliance and Risk Management: make sure all purchasing follows legal, ethical, and company standards, and they identify risks in the supply chain before they become problems.
	Support Sustainability and ESG Goals: play a role in helping the company meet environmental and social responsibility targets through ethical sourcing and sustainable practices.
	Procurement lead procure supplies wisely, oversee vendor relationships, negotiate contracts, lead teams and budgets to deliver value and lower costs.
	Strategic Sourcing and Supplier Management: investigate new vendors, contrast their products or services, negotiate prices, and establish trustworthy relationships. Monitor supplier performance, verify compliance with agreements over time, and modify sourcing plans to maintain cost savings, quality, and supply?chain resilience.
	Contract Negotiation and Compliance: securing favorable terms that are business appropriate, locally and globally compliant, and liability reducing. Establish mechanisms to extend, audit, and administer contracts effortlessly in the long term.
	Team Leadership and Talent Development: An excellent team is everything. Procurement leaders analysts, and managers, mentoring them and spreading best practices. They promote career development through training initiatives and professional certifications, keeping their teams sharp on negotiation skills, market dynamics, and ethics-based sourcing principles.
	Budget and Cost Optimization: review buying data, identify waste or duplication, and negotiate volume discounts. synchronize procurement budgets with corporate priorities, project future requirements, and match short-term savings with long-term value creation.


Skills and Qualifications Needed
To thrive as Procurement Lead a potent blend of soft and technical skills is needed, including:


	Degree in supply chain management, or Business Administration.
	3-6 years of work experience.
	Advanced degrees (e.g., MBA) and professional certifications from CIPS or ISM is an added advantage.
	Strategic thinking and commercial acumen
	Strong negotiation skills and legal awareness
	Deep understanding of supply chain management and market demands
	Proficiency in data analysis, financial analysis, procurement software, and reporting
	Excellent relationship building with suppliers and stakeholders
	Leadership and change management skills

	A Lead Procurement Officer isa senior leader responsible for an organization's entire procurement strategy and operations, from sourcing and cost management to risk mitigation and supplier relationships.

Responsibilities
A Lead Procurement wears many hats, combining strategy, leadership, and hands-on decision-making. Here's what they typically do:


	Develop Procurement Strategies: design long-term plans to ensure the company gets the best value from suppliers while supporting business goals like cost savings, sustainability, or innovation.
	Manage Supplier Relationships: negotiate contracts, handle disputes, and build strong partnerships with key suppliers to ensure quality and reliability.
	Lead the Procurement Team: supervise purchasing managers, buyers, and other procurement staff, ensuring the team runs smoothly and meets performance targets.
	Control Budgets and Costs: monitor spending, find savings opportunities, and help departments stay within budget without sacrificing quality.
	Ensure Compliance and Risk Management: make sure all purchasing follows legal, ethical, and company standards, and they identify risks in the supply chain before they become problems.
	Support Sustainability and ESG Goals: play a role in helping the company meet environmental and social responsibility targets through ethical sourcing and sustainable practices.
	Procurement lead procure supplies wisely, oversee vendor relationships, negotiate contracts, lead teams and budgets to deliver value and lower costs.
	Strategic Sourcing and Supplier Management: investigate new vendors, contrast their products or services, negotiate prices, and establish trustworthy relationships. Monitor supplier performance, verify compliance with agreements over time, and modify sourcing plans to maintain cost savings, quality, and supply?chain resilience.
	Contract Negotiation and Compliance: securing favorable terms that are business appropriate, locally and globally compliant, and liability reducing. Establish mechanisms to extend, audit, and administer contracts effortlessly in the long term.
	Team Leadership and Talent Development: An excellent team is everything. Procurement leaders analysts, and managers, mentoring them and spreading best practices. They promote career development through training initiatives and professional certifications, keeping their teams sharp on negotiation skills, market dynamics, and ethics-based sourcing principles.
	Budget and Cost Optimization: review buying data, identify waste or duplication, and negotiate volume discounts. synchronize procurement budgets with corporate priorities, project future requirements, and match short-term savings with long-term value creation.
